greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(r) where r ranges over the orders of all subgroups whose direct product gives the multiplicative group modulo n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(p) = p - 1 for odd primes p.
a(p^k) = phi(p^k) = (p-1)*p^(k-1) for odd primes p and k >= 1.
xref: Cf. A002322 (LCM over the orders of all subgroups), A052409, A289625, A290084.
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_, Mar 18 2016
ext: Terms a(1) and a(2) changed from 1 to 0 by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 07 2017
